document.docAuthor: Soliman, Ahmed M., Gadallah, Neveen S. & Al Dhafer, Hathal M.
document.docTitle: Oodera arabica Gadallah & Soliman, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: First record of the genus Oodera Westwood, 1874 (Hymenoptera, Pteromalidae, Cleonyminae, Ooderini) from the Arabian Peninsula, with the description of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First record of the genus Oodera Westwood, 1874 (Hymenoptera, Pteromalidae, Cleonyminae, Ooderini) from the Arabian Peninsula, with the description of four new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Oodera arabica Gadallah & Soliman sp. nov. Figs 2A , 3A , 4A , 5 (A, E), 6A, 7A, 8A, 9(A, E), 10A

Holotype ♀: SAUDI ARABIA, Al-Baha (Al-Mikhwah, Shada Al-Ala Natural Reserve), 29.iii.2017, leg. D. Baiocchi, e.l.
Acacia
[KSMA]. Paratype 1♀: SAUDI ARABIA, Al-Baha (Al-Mikhwah, The Ain Village), 13.iv.2016, leg. D. Baiocchi, e.l.
Acacia
sp. [KSMA].

Table 1. Diagnosis of
Oodera
species in the Arabian Peninsula.

tr.td: Length and shape of apical segment of maxillary palp
Pronotum length (according to its width), its anterior margin

subSubSection.paragraph: Female (holotype): Body length 7.2 mm (excluding the ovipositor).

Head. 1.6 x as wide as long, hea.w 4.5 x eye.d ( Fig. 5A ); face setiferous foveate-reticulate, setae lanceolate, white and short ( Fig. 5A ); msp.l 0.37 x head height ( Fig. 5E ); corona 0.6 x as long as eye.h ( Fig. 5A ); POL 1.37 x OOL ( Fig. 6A ); scape 3.23 x as long as pedicel; clava 0.15 x as long as funicle; flagellum 1.2 x as long as hea.w; F1 0.6 x as long as F2; F2 1.12 x as long as F3.

Mesosoma. Pronotum pentagonal, 0.48 x as long as mesonotum ( Fig. 8A ); mesonotum 1.38 x as long as mesoscutum ( Fig. 8A ); mesoscutum 0.9 x as long as wide ( Fig. 8A ); mesoscutellum 0.38 x as long as mesoscutum ( Fig. 8A ); profemur 1.4 x as long as protibia.

Forewing ( Fig. 10A ). Forewing 2.87 x as long as wide; costal cell 0.35 x as long as forewing; marginal vein 0.19 x as long as forewing; marginal vein 3.36 x as long as stigmal vein; postmarginal vein 3.86 x as long as stigmal vein.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The new species resembles the Afrotropical species
O. mkomaziensis
Werner & Peters (Tanzania) and
O. namibiensis
Werner & Peters (Namibia) in having body medium-sized (7.0−7.2 mm in length), head and mesosoma uniformly black with tinges of dark green and coppery or purple, eye large (eye.h/hea.h 0.72−0.74), corona thick (cor.l/cor.w 3.08−3.60), with structure interrupted and propodeum medium (ppd.l/msc.l 0.15). It differs from
O. mkomaziensis
in the following: body robust, msn.l/msc.w 1.25−1.29 (in
mkomaziensis
slender, msn.l/msc.w 1.5); head rounded, 1.34−1.38 x as high as long (oval, 1.56 x as high as long in
mkomaziensis
); pronotum pentagonal (oval in
mkomaziensis
); mesoscutellum entirely lineate (in
mkomaziensis
lineate in anterior two-thirds, finely areolate in posterior third); metasoma short, 0.42−0.43 x as long as body (in
mkomaziensis
longer, 0.52 x as long as body). The new species also differs from
O. namibiensis
in the following: forewing hyaline (partly infumate in
namibiensis
); antennal scape and pedicel and basal half of F1 are red, rest of antenna black (scape yellow, darkened apically, rest of antenna black in
namibiensis
); metasoma short, 0.42−0.43 x as long as body length (in
namibiensis
medium to long, 0.49−0.55 x as long as body length).
Named in reference to the country of Saudi Arabia, where the type specimen was collected.
